channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report X-2024111018
item.description:
Report X-2024111018

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-28T06:19:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-19
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment leaked due to insufficient tap on the bottom of the box. The box broke open from the bottom when it was picked up by an employee. The inner contents (plastic bottles) fell out of the box, damaging one (top came off). 4 Plastic bottles at 4L each. Product info: Rite Kem Stainless Steel Maintainer Concentrated. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2024110490
item.description:
Report E-2024110490

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-27T12:24:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-18
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 24, 2024, at 1346 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Atlanta, GA regarding the release of Greasestrip Plus (Sodium Hydroxide Solution). Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 2 cups of Greasestrip Plus (UN1824, 8, II) from (1) 1-gallon container onto the trailer floor. The release was reportedly due to products rubbing together and creating a leak, impacting a 4’ x 4’ area in the trailer. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was neutralized then cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. Recovered product was re-palletized for the client per client’s instruction. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024110773
item.description:
Report X-2024110773

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-18
  • City: Savannah
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During normal switching operations, yard crew reported seeing a liquid running down the side of UTLX 205315 originating around the manway. A response contractor was called to investigate the leak and repair the car. The contractor found the manway swing bolts were less than tool tight with most being able to be turned by hand. The contractor opened the manway and inspected the manway lid gasket and found it in acceptable condition. The manway was closed and properly secured in a tool tight condition. The other service fittings were inspected with no other exceptions noted.

UN3481 Lithium ion batteries contained in equipment Class 9 Single Package or Inner Packaging (if any): Packaging Type: Case Material of Construction: Plastic Package Capacity: 204 g Amount in Package: 204 g Number in Shipment 1 Number Failed: 1

item.title: Report I-2024100159
item.description:
Report I-2024100159

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-23
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: STG LOGISTICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. A leak was detected beneath pallet, while staged at the STG Logistics facility, pending transit. Upon inspection, it appeared to have been struck by a forklift. Area was secured, and Environmental Restoration was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, ERLLC detected one 5 gallon metal drum had been punctured. Approximately 3 gallons of free product were released to the pallet, and warehouse floor. ERLLC utilized absorbent material on the warehouse floor, and containerized the spent absorbent, debris, and leaking drum into one 55-gallon recovery drum. There were no injuries or exposures reported

item.title: Report I-2024100157
item.description:
Report I-2024100157

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-23
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: STG LOGISTICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. A leak was detected beneath pallet, while staged at the STG Logistics facility, pending transit. Upon inspection, it appeared to have been struck by a forklift. Area was secured, and Environmental Restoration was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, ERLLC sorted the pallet to detect the leakers. Approximately 3 gallons of free product were released to the pallet, cardboard, and facility floor. ERLLC sorted freight, overpacked 22 contaminated cardboard cartons and damaged bottles into 3 55-gallon drums, along with spent absorbent material utilized on the facility floor, and recovered all free product. There were no injuries or exposures reported

item.title: Report E-2024110400
item.description:
Report E-2024110400

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-13
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 13, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printer ink was punctured and released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged drum was containerized in one (1) 85-gallon overpack.
